intro: Neopringlea trinervia, commonly known as the slender leaf fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, linear fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori on the undersides of its fronds. Neopringlea trinervia is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
